* Pieces is unable to download OLLAMA due to the program requiring `curl`, which may not be installed on all systems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented**
* Patch is being developed by Pieces to enable Ollama usage within the snap environment.

**Outcome**
* Fix for the download and inference issue is still in progress.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## High Memory and CPU Usage in Pieces OS: Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* High RAM usage of PiecesOS, reaching up to 5GB or more, with reports of background mining.
* Significant CPU spikes, sometimes exceeding 50%, impacting system performance.
* Issues triggered even when PiecesOS is running in the background and with no models actively running.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leak causing excessive RAM consumption.
* Underlying database technology potentially contributing to resource usage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Memory optimization feature implemented (reduces 1GB of RAM usage).
* Replacement of heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to address CPU and memory concerns.
* Further performance improvements planned for future releases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 released to address memory and CPU issues.
* Users are encouraged to upgrade and report their experience with the new version.

**Additional Notes:**

* Live Context feature, crucial for Pieces' functionality, contributes to resource consumption.
* Turning off Live Context can reduce RAM usage.
* Users reporting issues exceeding 2GB RAM or experiencing significant CPU spikes are encouraged to contact Pieces for further assistance.

**Overall:**

While Pieces acknowledges the resource consumption issues and actively works to improve performance, users may still experience high memory and CPU usage with specific configurations or heavy workloads. The Pieces team encourages continuous feedback and collaboration to refine the software.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with connecting to PiecesOS.
* The issue was escalated to Pieces support team.
* Raju-git20 tried the new port 39300 but it didn't work.
* Raju-git20 shared screenshots of the error.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS migrated to a new port (39300) with version 11.0.0.
* Raju-git20's application was unable to connect to PiecesOS using the new port.
* The port range for PiecesOS was dynamic and determined by a file.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-Pieces suggested that Raju-git20 check the port-finding algorithm in their application.
* Mark-at-Pieces offered to connect Raju-git20 with the right people at Pieces to help with development.
* Mark-at-Pieces shared their calendar link to schedule a call with Raju-git20.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Raju-git20 accepted the calendar invite and a call is scheduled to discuss the issue further.

**Additional notes:**

* Raju-git20's project involves using Python and AI to connect and apply for positions on LinkedIn.
* Mark-at-Pieces expressed interest in learning more about Raju-git20's project.

**Overall, the conversation shows that the Pieces support team is responsive and willing to help users with issues.**

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Ollama installation failures:** This issue is prevalent on both Windows and Linux and presents a significant barrier to users leveraging local LLM capabilities.

**Investigate and address PiecesOS performance issues:** High RAM/CPU usage, LTM sandbox issues, and Copilot service errors are recurring concerns that impact user experience.  Focus on optimizing resource consumption and improving overall stability.

**Improve Pieces OS and Desktop App installation and update processes:** Users encounter frequent errors with the .appinstaller method and experience difficulties updating the Desktop App. Streamline these processes and provide clearer guidance to users.
**Enhance communication around Pieces OS port changes:** The shift to port 39300 in version 11.0.0 has caused confusion. Clearly document this change and update support resources accordingly.
**Consider developing a dedicated troubleshooting guide for common issues:** This would empower users to self-resolve problems and potentially reduce support ticket volume.
